alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 24 at 1:17AM PST until December 24 at 4:15AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Apple and El Dorado burn scar in... Riverside County in southern California... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 415 AM PST. * At 117 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling over the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 0.75 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Raywood Flats has reported 0.60" of rain in the last hour. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Birch Creek, Potato Canyon, Little San Gorgonio Creek, Forsee Creek, Glen Martin Creek, Oak Glen Creek, Wilson Creek, Mountain Home Creek, San Gorgonio River, Portrero Creek, Mias Canyon, Corral Canyon, Millard Canyon, and the south fork of the Whitewater River. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding in and around the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yucaipa, Forest Falls, southeastern Mount San Gorgonio, Beaumont, Banning, Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit, Mountain Home Village, Angelus Oaks, Cherry Valley and Morongo Indian Reservation. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-0.75 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall may cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks, streams, and ditches in the El Dorado and Apple Burn Scars. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters, climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
